result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine Sherod Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with TCF Bank.  No contact with the co-defendant's.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: For Def to come from RCI to court on May 12, 2016. @2:45 PM
Sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Antoine Sherod Cook
Current: Racine Correctional Institution, Sturtevant, WI 53177   (Effective: 03-08-2016)
Prior: 6402 24th Ave, Kenosha, WI 53142

Defendant Antoine Sherod Cook in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Antoine Sherod Cook in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense notes that the jury pool is made up of mostly caucasian persons and the defendant is African-American. Defense is concerned about no African-American's being in the first 23 names. Defense is given the opportunity to speak with the defendant. Defense wishes to have the names re-tumbled. After speaking with the defendant, Ms. Lang-Muffitt indicates that if the State would put the offer back on the table, he would like to take advantage of it. The State agrees.
The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon plea to Ct 1 - the State recommends 10 yrs WPS bifurcated as 6 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES and on Ct 2 - State recommends WPS of an unspecified amount and ss as to cons/conc.
P-NC to Ct 1 and G to Ct 2
COP filed, rights given
deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Antoine Sherod Cook in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Antoine Sherod Cook in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that the defendant will stipulate that his statements were free and voluntary. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant.

BTC: The defendant waives his right to challenge his statement and therefore, the State may use his statment in its case in chief and upon rebuttal.

Regarding final pretrial. All State's witnesses are supoena'd and served. All discovery issues are complied with. The State has extended a new offer today and it expires at 5:00 o'clock today. The defendant rejects the offer and JT will commence. The State asks that Officer Diener be allowed to sit at prosecution table to be their designated representative. Trial is expected to last 2 1/2 - 3 days. Parties agree on 1 alternate, 5 strikes.

BTC: JT remains
